alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Muscatine; Scott; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 8:44PM CST until December 01 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations generally under 1 inch north of a line from Sigourney to Clinton. Ice accumulations of a light glazing possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Illinois and east central and southeast Iowa. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan for slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain is expected to develop late tonight into early Friday morning, which may mix with light freezing rain for a brief period early Friday morning. A mix of rain and snow is then possible north of Interstate 80 through the mid to late morning on Friday with little in the way of accumulation expected. Slippery travel conditions are possible early Friday morning, especially north of Interstate 80.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Iowa; Jefferson; Johnson; Keokuk; Muscatine; Scott; Washington
